luo: Otieno wacho kama, "Ka ne ane klas achiel, gima ne okwong nyiswa ni watim ne en goro mtoka. Ne agoro gach pikap, ma japuonj nochuoyona tik makwar. Chakre kindeno, ne ang'eyo ni gimoro amora maber onego obed gi tik makwar. Mano e ndalo mane afwenyoe ni goro mit."
mt0: <pad> “我画了一辆车,老师喜欢并给了我一个红点。从那时候开始,我知道任何好的东西都应该有一个红点。这是那时我意识到绘画是好。”</s>

en: In Class Five, he started using coloured pencil.
luo: Ka ne ochopo e klas abich, ne ochako goro kotiyo gi kalas.
mt0: <pad> In Class Five, he started using coloured pencil.</s>

en: Later, he moved to Nairobi and did some causal jobs in the city’s Industrial Area as a causal labourer, though he never stopped painting, albeit for fun.
luo: Bang'e ne odhi Nairobi kendo notiyo tije matindo tindo e Industrial Area, kata kamano, ne ok oweyo goro nikech nohero ahinya timo kamano.
mt0: <pad> Later, he moved to Nairobi and did some causal jobs in the city's Industrial Area as a causal labourer, though he never stopped painting, albeit for fun.</s>

en: “In the year 2007 I received Sh3,000 for a paint I did for then Health Minister Charity Ngilu and Sh7,000 from a former Kenya Dairy Board managing director. I then knew art pays,” said Otieno at his art studio in Milimani Court in Obama Estate, Nairobi.
luo: Otieno ma sani nigi studio mare e Milimani Court e Obama Estate, Nairobi, wacho kama: "E higa mar 2007, ne ochula siling 3,000 kane agoro Charity Ngilu ma ne ochung' ne Migawo mar Thieth ndalono, kendo nayudo siling 7,000 ka ne agoro dairekta machon mar Kenya Dairy Board. Nafwenyo ni kara goro nigi pesa."
mt0: <pad> “In 2007 I received Sh3,000 for a paint I did for then Health Minister Charity Ngilu and Sh7,000 from a former Kenya Dairy Board managing director. I then knew art pays,” said Otieno at his art studio in Milimani Court in Obama Estate, Nairobi.</s>

en: He quit the casual job, used the Sh30,000 he received after painting a picture of former President Daniel Moi to buy drawing equipment.
luo: Ne oweyo tich ma ne otiyo kae to otiyo gi siling 30,000 mane omiye kogoro Ker machon Daniel Moi e ng'iewo gige goro.
mt0: <pad> He quit his casual job, used the Sh30,000 he received after painting a picture of former President Daniel Moi to buy drawing equipment.</s>

en: He then set up a small workshop and ventured into commercial art.
luo: Kae to noyawo nyaduka moro matin mane ousoe gik mogoro.
mt0: <pad> He then set up a small workshop and ventured into commercial art.</s>

en: In 2002 when President Uhuru Kenyatta was running for presidency, Otieno saw a picture of former President Moi published in The Standard wearing a red kitenge shirt decorated with Kenya African National Union (Kanu) colours and a cockerel.
luo: E higa mar 2002, kane Ker Uhuru Kenyatta dwaro bedo ker, Otieno ne oneno picha mar ker machon Moi koket e The Standard korwako kitenge makwar ma nigi rangi mag KANU kod gweno.
mt0: <pad> In 2002 when President Uhuru Kenyatta was running for president, Otieno saw a picture of former President Moi published in The Standard wearing a red kitenge shirt decorated with Kenya African National Union (Kanu) colours and a cockerel.</s>

en: “I drew Mzee Moi and besides him put President Kenyatta. I then drew Kanu flag and wrote, “Kanu Yajenga Nchi”.
luo: Otieno wacho ni "Ne agoro Mzee Moi kae to e bathe agoro Ker Kenyatta. Nagoro bendech KANU kae to andiko ni: "Kanu Yajenga Nchi".
mt0: <pad> "Nā sɔ Mzee Moi na tɔ́n ɖo Kenyatta. Na sɔ Kanu flag na sɔ, "Kanu Yajenga Nchi" na sɔ.</s>

en: "A neighbour saw and liked it. He introduced me to a friend called Mutua, who worked with then Presidential Escort Unit. Mutua asked him to bring the painting so that he could see it,” said Otieno.
luo: Nitie jiranda ma ne oneno pichano mohere. Bang'e, ne otuda gi osiepne moro miluongo ni Mutua ma ndalono ne tiyo gi askeche makowoga gach ker. Mutua ne onyise mondo okel picha mogorno mondo one."
mt0: <pad> "Mɔ̌ ɖo nǔ sɔ́ yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě, nǔ sɔ́ yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn lɛ́ɛ wè xá yě tɔn

en: They met and Mutua introduced him to a University of Nairobi lecturer Prof Geoffrey ole Maloiy, a close friend of the late Mzee Moi, who took the painting to the President.
luo: Ne giromo kendo Mutua ne otude gi japuonj matiyo e Yunivasiti mar Nairobi Profesa Geoffrey Ole Maloiy, ma ne en osipe Mzee Moi. Ne okawo pichano momiyo Ker.
mt0: <pad> They met and Mutua introduced him to a lecturer at the University of Nairobi Prof Geoffrey ole Maloiy, a close friend of the late Mzee Moi, who took the painting to the President.</s>

en: “Within two days, Mutua called me and said Moi liked it and had paid Sh30,000. That was the first good amount I received from art and it was like a jackpot. The joy that President Moi liked my work and paid for it inspired me a lot,” said Otieno, born in Seme, Kisumu County.
luo: Otieno dhi nyime lero niya, "Bang' odiechienge ariyo, Mutua nogochona monyisa ni Moi nohero pichano kendo ochulo siling 30,000. Mano e pesa maber mane ahango yudo kuom goro. Ne amor ahinya ng'eyo ni Ker Moi nohera tija mochula pesa to wachno jiwaga ahinya."
mt0: <pad> “Within two days, Mutua called me and said Moi liked it and had paid Sh30,000. That was the first good amount I received from art and it was like a jackpot. The joy that President Moi liked my work and paid for it inspired me a lot,” said Otieno, born in Seme, Kisumu County.</s>

en: He has also sold two paintings of former US President Barrack Obama to an art collector, which fetched him Sh500,000.
luo: Bende, ne ouso pichni moko ariyo mag Ker machon mar Amerka, Barrack Obama, ne ng'at moro mohero choko gik mogor kendo nochule siling 500,000.
mt0: <pad> He has also sold two paintings of former US President Barack Obama to an art collector, which fetched him Sh500,000.</s>

en: However, there is a Cabinet Secretary he claims owes him Sh30,000.
luo: Kata kamano, owacho ni nitie Cabinet Secretary moro ma obandho siling 30,000.
mt0: <pad> However, there is a Cabinet Secretary he claims owes him Sh30,000.</s>

en: He didn’t give details.
luo: Ne ok ofulo nyinge.
mt0: <pad> He didn't give details.</s>

en: “There are two pictures I painted of former President Mwai Kibaki on a wheelchair and another in his office. They cost Sh500,000 but I was never paid,” said Otieno.
luo: Otieno wacho kama, "Nitie pichni ariyo ma ne agoro mag ker machon Mwai Kibaki ka en e wheelchair gi machielo ka en e ofis. Nengogi giduto en siling 500,000 to ne ok ochula."
mt0: <pad> "I painted two pictures of Mwai Kibaki on a wheelchair and one in his office. They cost Sh500,000 but I was never paid," said Otieno.</s>

en: It was all glamour at the 2018 Kalasha awards ceremony held on Saturday evening at the Safari Park Hotel in Nairobi.
luo: Mor lilo ne opong'o nyasi mar 2018 Kalasha awards ma ne otimore Ngeso godhiambo e Safari Park Hotel, Nairobi.
mt0: <pad> 你不知道</s>

en: The red carpet event hosted by the Kenya Film Commission, in its eighth edition, featured the who’s who in the film industry, dignitaries and top Government officials.
luo: Nyasi manyadhino ne ochan gi Kenya Film Commission ka ma e nyasi mar aboro, kendo joma ne obiro gin joma tek tek e sinembe, welo modhial kod joma nigi migepe madongo e Sirkal.
mt0: <pad> The red carpet event hosted by the Kenya Film Commission, in its eighth edition, featured the who’s who in the film industry, dignitaries and top Government officials.</s>

en: Journalists Amina Rabar and Jeff Koinange made sure the audience was entertained with their tickling punchlines as they emceed the event.
luo: MC mag nyasino ne gin jofwombo Amina Rabar kod Jeff Koinange kendo ne ginego  ji gi nyiero.
mt0: <pad> 你不知道</s>

en: Baringo Senator Gideon Moi, ICT Cabinet Secretary Joe Mucheru, principal secretaries Fatuma Hirsi and Jerome Ochieng, Nairobi Woman Representative Esther Passaris and officials from the French embassy attended the function. Others included actors Charles Bukeko (Papa Shirandula), Mary Khavere (Mama Kayai), Lucy Wangui and Pascal Tokodi.
luo: Joma ne obiro e nyasino oriwo Seneta ma Baringo, Gideon Moi, Jatend migawo mar ICT Joe Mucheru, principal secretaries Fatuma Hirsi kod Jerome Ochieng', Nairobi Woman Representative Esther Passaris kod joma tiyo e ofis mbetre mar France. Jomamoko noriwo jotugo Charles Bukeko (Papa Shirandula), Mary Khavere (Mama Kayai), Lucy Wangui kod Pascal Tokodi.
mt0: <pad> Senator Gideon Moi, ICT Cabinet Secretary Joe Mucheru, principal secretaries Fatuma Hirsi and Jerome Ochieng, Nairobi Woman Representative Esther Passaris and officials from the French embassy attended the function. Others included actors Charles Bukeko (Papa Shirandula), Mary Khavere (Mama Kayai), Lucy Wangui and Pascal Tokodi.</s>

en: Senator Gideon lauded the event for celebrating and rewarding local talent and sustaining the future of the local music industry.
luo: Seneta Gideon ne opwoyo nyasani kuom jiwo kendo siro Jo-Kenya ma nigi mich mag wer.
mt0: <pad> Senator Gideon praised the event for celebrating and rewarding local talent and sustaining the future of the local music industry.</s>

en: The Kanu chairman also applauded the Kenya Film Commission and Kalasha for a job well done.
luo: Jakomno mar KANU bende ne opwoyo Kenya Film Commission kod Kalasha kuom timo tich maber.
mt0: <pad> The Kanu chairman also praised the Kenya Film Commission and Kalasha for a well done job.</s>

en: “We want the local film industry to set the trend and make upcoming and aspiring musicians feel like they want to be part of it in years to come. With this kind of event, Kenya could easily provide 90 per cent local content and not be boring,” said Gideon.
luo: Gideon ne owacho kama, "Wadwaro ni joma loso sinembe Kenya obed namba achiel e kelo paro manyien kendo gjiw jower ma eka chako mondo obed gi siso mar riwore kodgi. Ka nyasi kaka mae nitie, Kenya nyalo loso mayot pasent 90 mag sinembe minyiso e tv kendo ji ok bi ol nenogi."
mt0: <pad> “We want the local film industry to set the trend and make upcoming and aspiring musicians feel like they want to be part of it in years to come. With this kind of event, Kenya could easily provide 90 per cent local content and not be boring,” said Gideon.</s>

en: CS Mucheru commended the winners and requested the local Kenya Film Commission to inject new blood and life into the local film industry.
luo: CS Mucheru nopwoyo joma ne olocho kendo nokwayo Kenya Film Commision mondo gikel ji kod paro manyien e sinembe ma giloso.
mt0: <pad> CS Mucheru commended the winners and requested the local Kenya Film Commission to inject new blood and life into the local film industry.</s>

en: He said President Uhuru Kenyatta’s administration was committed to having the local film industry transform the country.
luo: Nowacho ni sirkand Ker Uhuru Kenyatta tiyo matek mondo sinembe miloso Kenya olok piny.
mt0: <pad> He said the Kenyan government was committed to having the local film industry transform the country.</s>

en: “We want to come out with a blockbuster movie to be sold in Africa, China and the rest of the world. We also want to set up a task force to ensure that we transform the local film industry by building theatres in all the 47 counties with the support of my ministry, the Nairobi senator, the Government and the media to ensure we come out with the best in terms of movies,” said Mr Mucheru.
luo: Mucheru nowacho kama, "Wadwaro loso sinema moro maduong' ma ibiro us e Afrika, China kod piny duto. Bende, nitie grup ma dwaro loso ma dhi nyime gi tich mar neno ni gikelo lokruoge moko kaka gero kuonde neno sinema e kaonti duto 47 ka ikonyogi gi migawo ma atiyoe, seneta mar Nairobi, Sirkal kod ute fwambo mondo mi walos sinembe mabeyo ahinya."
mt0: <pad> “我们想出一部电影,可以卖到非洲、中国和世界上其他地方。我们还想成立一个工作小组来确保我们改变了当地的电影行业,建造电影院在47个省区,以我的部份、Nairobi senator、政府和媒体的帮助来保证我们做出最好的电影。”</s>

en: There was also a moment of silence to pay tribute to fallen heroes among them former Vitimbi and Vioja Mahakamani actor Charles Kimani alias Masaku, former Churchill comedian Emmanuel Makori popularly known as Ayeiya and Mombasa-based actress Maureen Wanza,popularly known as Sasha.
luo: Ji ne okawo thuolo mar paro jogo ma osetho ma ne ong'ere moriwo ji kaka Charles Kimani mong'ere kaka Masaku e Vitimbi kod Vioja Mahakamani, ja miji nyiero e Churchil show Emmanuel Makori ma ne ong'ere kaka Ayeiya kod jatuk sinema ma niga Mombasa, Maureen Wanza ma ne ong'ere kaka Sasha.
mt0: <pad> Also there was a moment of silence to pay tribute to fallen heroes among them former Vitimbi and Vioja Mahakamani actor Charles Kimani alias Masaku, former Churchill comedian Emmanuel Makori popularly known as Ayeiya and Mombasa-based actress Maureen Wanza,popularly known as Sasha.</s>

en: Organisers asked Kenyans to help pay the hospital bill for actor Kone Nouhoum of Selina, who was involved in an accident a few weeks ago and is in the ICU.
luo: Joma ne ochano nyasino ne okwayo Jo-Kenya mondo gikony e chulo bill mar osiptal ne jatuk sinema Kone Nouhoum mar Selina, ma ne oyudo aksident jumbe moko mokalo kendo sani nie ICU.
mt0: <pad> Organisers asked Kenyans to help pay the hospital bill for actor Kone Nouhoum of Selina, who was involved in an accident a few weeks ago and is in the ICU.</s>

en: Kalasha International Awards is an annual event presented by the Kenya Film Commission whose mandate is to promote a vibrant local film industry.
luo: Kalasha International Awards en nyasi mitimoga higa ka higa kitayo gi Kenya Film Commission ma dwache maduong' en loso sinembe mabeyo ma ji ohero.
mt0: <pad> Kalasha International Awards i nǔ yě ɖo Kenya Film Commission tɔn e sɔ ɖo gɔnu a, e nǔ yě ɖo gɔnu a, e nǔ yě ɖo gɔnu a.</s>

en: The initiative seeks to recognise talent in the different facets of film and TV industry by awarding those in the five original branches of filmmaking: directors, actors, writers, producers and technicians.
luo: Nyasino temo ahinya mondo gijiw tich matek ma ji timo e loso sinema kod programbe mag TV ka gichiwo mich ne kidienje abich mong'ere e chenro mar loso sinema ma gin: dairekta, jotug sinema, jondiko, jomaloso sinema kod funde.
mt0: <pad> 这个活动是为了表彰电影和电视行业的不同面部,通过颁奖那些在五种原初的领域:导演、演员、编剧、制作人、技术人员。</s>

en: It was a big moment for those who bagged awards. Kenya’s film industry is growing slowly but surely, with people like Wanuri Kahiu getting recognised internationally for their work in film.
luo: Jogo ma ne oyudo mich ne omor ahinya. Sinembe miloso Kenya dhi nyime timo dongruok mosmos, ka jomoko kaka Wanuri Kahiu to ong'ere e piny ngima gi tije e sinema.
mt0: <pad> It was a big moment for those who bagged awards. Kenya's film industry is growing slowly but surely, with people like Wanuri Kahiu getting recognised internationally for their work in film.</s>

en: The event was sponsored by KTN, Communications Authority of Kenya, Anga Imax, Canon Kenya, French embassy, Kenya Broadcasting Corporation, Buzz, Kwese Inflix, Media Council of Kenya, Movie Mtaani, Pixel, Scoop Network, Safari Park Hotel, Telcom Kenya, USIU, and Brand Kenya.
luo: Sponsa mag nyasino ne gin KTN, Communications Authoriy of Kenyha, Anga Imax, Canon Kenya, French embassy, Kenya Broadcasting Corporation, Buzz, Kwese Inflix, Media Council of Kenya, Movie Mtaani, Pixel, Scoop Network, Safari Park Hotel, Telcom Kenya, USIU kod Brand Kenya.
mt0: <pad> 这个活动由KTN, Communications Authority of Kenya, Anga Imax, Canon Kenya, French embassy, Kenya Broadcasting Corporation, Buzz, Kwese Inflix, Media Council of Kenya, Movie Mtaani, Pixel, Scoop Network, Safari Park Hotel, Telcom Kenya, USIU, and Brand Kenya.</s>

en: Writer King’ori Gachoka was 22 years old when he first met celebrated author Francis Imbuga.
luo: Jandiko miluongo ni King'ori Gachoka ne jahigni 22 ka ne ohango romo gi jandiko mong'ere Francis Imbuga.
mt0: <pad> Writer King'ori Gachoka was 22 years old when he first met celebrated author Francis Imbuga.</s>

en: Things were so bad for the budding writer such that he could not afford a typewriter.
luo: Weche ne dhi maber ne jandiko maa pinyno kendo ne ok nyal kata ng'iewo typewriter.
mt0: <pad> Things were so bad for the budding writer that he couldn't afford a typewriter.</s>

en: His script for a play had just been rejected by a local television station because it was handwritten, and he thought this could end his dream.
luo: Nitie tugo ma ne ondiko motero e TV, kata kamano jogo notamore nikech ne nondiko gi lwete kendo noparo ni mano e giko lek mare.
mt0: <pad> His script for a play had just been rejected by a local television station because it was handwritten, and he thought this could end his dream.</s>

en: At the time, Gachoka was a student at Kenyatta University where the late Prof Imbuga, then 47 years old, was his dean, in the Arts Department.
luo: E kindeno, Gachoko ne en japuonjre e Kenyatta University kaman Profesa Imbuga ma ne jahigni 47 kindeno, ne en dean mare e Arts Department.
mt0: <pad> At the time, Gachoka was a student at Kenyatta University where Prof Imbuga, then 47 years old, was his dean in the Arts Department.</s>

en: His frustrations led him to share the rejected piece with Imbuga with the aim of borrowing his typewriter.
luo: Nopimone Imbuga chandruok ma ne en-go ka dwache en ni Imbuga okonye gi typewriter.
mt0: <pad> His frustration led him to share the rejected piece with Imbuga with the aim of borrowing his typewriter.</s>

en: The professor was impressed with his work and allowed him to use his valuable Olympia Traveller DeLuxe portable typewriter.
luo: Profesano ne omor ahinya gima nondiko mi oyiene mondo oti gi masin mare ma nengone tek miluongo ni Olympia Traveller DeLuxe portable typewritter.
mt0: <pad> The professor was impressed with his work and allowed him to use his valuable Olympia Traveller DeLuxe portable typewriter.</s>

en: Yesterday, Gachoka, who will soon turn 47, could not hold back his tears as he parted with the typewriter, the same one that kick-started his career as well as Imbuga’s.
luo: Nyoro Gachoka, ma biro rwako higni 47 machiegni, ne oywako sama ne ochiwo typewriter ma ne en kachiel gi Imbuga ochakogo tich.
mt0: <pad> Gachoka, who will soon turn 47 years old, yesterday could not hold back his tears as he parted with the typewriter, the same one that kick-started his career as well as Imbuga’s.</s>

en: The typewriter will now be part of the exhibition of Imbuga’s literary works.
luo: Typewriter-no koro biro bedo achiel kuom gik mitang'o kinyiso tije Imbuga.
mt0: <pad> The typewriter will now be part of the exhibition of Imbuga’s literary works.</s>

en: “I took time to prepare myself because I knew it was not going to be an easy thing. So in July and August this year, I carried the typewriter to every meeting I attended and everywhere I went,” said Gachoka.
luo: Gachoka ne owacho kama, "Ne akawo thuolo mondo aikra maber nikech ne ang'eyo ni ok odhi bedo mayot chiwo. Omiyo e dwe mar Julai kod Agost higani, ne ating'oga typewriter-no e romo duto kod kamoro amora ma ne adhiye."
mt0: <pad> “我花了时间准备自己,因为我知道这不是一个简单的事。所以在七月和八月这个年里,我带了我的笔记本到每个会议我参加过,也到任何地方我去了,” Gachoka said.</s>

en: Gachoka, who spoke during the launch of the exhibition yesterday, reminisced the days when he was struggling. He also narrated how the professor surprised him when he returned the typewriter.
luo: Gachoka ma ne owuoyo nyoro e nyasi mitang'o tije Imbuga, ne owacho ni oparo ndalo ma ne ochandore. Nowacho gima profesa notimone ka ne oduokone typewriter.
mt0: <pad> Gachoka, who spoke at the launch of the exhibition yesterday, recalled the days when he was struggling. He also narrated how the professor surprised him when he returned the typewriter when he surprised him when the professor returned it.</s>

en: “It is yours now. I gave it to you,” said Imbuga to Gachoka’s amazement.
luo: Imbuga nonyise niya, "Koro en mari. Amiyogo." To mano kaka Gachoka ne omor.
mt0: <pad> “It is yours now. I gave it to you,” said Imbuga to Gachoka’s amazement.</s>

en: The typing machine, though slow, is still in good working condition.
luo: Kata obedo ni masin mar ndikono dhi mos, pod otiyo maber.
mt0: <pad> 虽然电脑很慢,但还是可以使用。</s>

en: Gachoka’s first literary work, a novel titled Divided Life, which thrust him into the  literature field, was produced using the type writer.
luo: Buk ma Gachoka nokwongo ndiko ne en sigana miluongo ni 'Divide Life' (Ngima Mopogore) ne omiyo ong'ere e kaka jandiko kendo bugno ne olos gi typewriter.
mt0: <pad> Gachoka's first literary work, a novel titled Divided Life, which thrust him into the literature field, was produced using the type writer.</s>

en: The novel saw him brush shoulders with big names in the industry such as Prof Egara Kabaji, who was present during the launch of the exhibition.
luo: Bugno nomiyo otudre gi ji ma nigi huma tij ndiko kaka Profesa Egara Kabaji ma ne obiro e nyasino.
mt0: <pad> The novel saw him brush shoulders with big names in the industry such as Prof Egara Kabaji, who was present during the launch of the exhibition.</s>

en: Standard Group Chief Executive Officer Orlando Lyomu, who was the chief guest, said the exhibition would give Kenyans an opportunity to interact with Imbuga’s thoughts.
luo: CEO mar Standard Group Orlando Lyomu ma ne en wendo modhial nowacho ni nyasino dhi miyo Jo-Kenya thuolo mar ng'eyo pach Imbuga.
mt0: <pad> Standard Group Chief Executive Officer Orlando Lyomu, who was the chief guest, said the exhibition would give Kenyans an opportunity to interact with Imbuga’s ideas.</s>

en: He said the media requires more content and called on those with ideas on drama to come up.
luo: Nowacho ni jofwambo dwaro paro manyien kendo nowacho ni jogo mong'eyo ndiko drama onego manye.
mt0: <pad> He said the media needs more content and urged those with ideas on drama to come up.</s>

en: “Do not shy away from partnering with us, this will help us continue mentoring talents in honour of the late Imbuga,” said Lyomu.
luo: Lyomu nowacho kama, "Kik iluor riwori kodwa, ma biro konyowa dhi nyime siro joma nigi mich ka waparogo Imbuga."
mt0: <pad> “Do not shy away from partnering with us, this will help us continue mentoring talents in honour of the late Imbuga,” said Lyomu.</s>

en: To promote national heritage, Lyomu said, Standard Group will continue partnering with the Kenya National Archives, as it celebrates its heritage as the oldest media group in the region.
luo: Lyomu nowacho ni Standard Group siro kano weche mag piny kokalo kuom tiyo kanyachiel gi Kenya National Archives sama gitimo nyasi mar bedo od fwambo mosebudho aming'a moloyo moro amora.
mt0: <pad> To promote national heritage, Lyomu said, Standard Group will continue partnering with the Kenya National Archives, as it celebrates its heritage as the oldest media group in the region.</s>

en: Other guests present were Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology Vice Chancellor Fred Otieno and his Kenyatta University counterpart Paul Wainaina.
luo: Welo mamoko ma ne obiro ne en Vice Chancellor mar Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology, Fred Otieno kod Paul Wainaina mar Kenyatta University.
mt0: <pad> 其他客人包括了Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology Vice Chancellor Fred Otieno和Kenyatta University counterpart Paul Wainaina。</s>

en: During the exhibition, Kenya National Archives will not charge the public. The exhibition will run until April 2019.
luo: E kinde ma nyasino dhi nyime, Kenya National Archives ok kwayo ji pesa mar donjo. Nyasino biro dhi nyime nyaka April 2019.
mt0: <pad> 在展览期间,肯尼亚国家档案馆不会收取费用。展览将持续到四月。</s>

en: Dubbed “An Exhibition of Prof Francis Imbuga’s Literary Works”, the gallery is a package of his entire life, containing photos from his days as an actor.
luo: Pinchnigo ondik ni ni "Ranyisi mag Gik ma Profesa Imbuga Nondiko" kendo pichni man kanyo nyiso ngimane duto, moriwo nyaka pichni mag ndalo ma ne en jatugo.
mt0: <pad> 被称为“An Exhibition of Prof Francis Imbuga’s Literary Works”,展览是他整个生命的集锦,包含照片从他的演员时期。</s>

en: Imbuga’s works have become key in the study of literature schools in Kenya, with the most famous one being Betrayal in the City.
luo: Buge ma Imbuga ondiko itiyogo ahinya e skunde man Kenya ka buge mong'ere ahinya en Betrayal in the City.
mt0: <pad> Imbuga's works have become key in the study of literature schools in Kenya, with the most famous one being Betrayal in the City.</s>

en: It also has photos of his young family and those taken just before he died.
luo: Oting'o bende pichni mag jood Imbuga kod pichni ma ne ogoye ka pok otho.
mt0: <pad> It also has photos of his young family and those taken just before he died.</s>

en: His other books include Aminata, Man of Kafira, The Burning of Rags and The Successor.
luo: Buge mamako ma ne ondiko gin: Aminata, Man of Kafira, The Burning of Rags kod The Successor.
mt0: <pad> His other books include Aminata, Man of Kafira, The Burning of Rags and The Successor.</s>

en: Imbuga’s works have consistently brought out issues that affect the society such as the clashes of modernity and tradition in the social organisation of African communities.
luo: Buge ma Imbuga ondiko kinde mang'eny wuoyo e wi chandruoge ma ji romogo kaka wach ma ji laro e wi kaka ji odak sani kod owinjore Jo Afrika dag kaluwore gi kitgi machon.
mt0: <pad> Imbuga's works have consistently brought out issues that affect the society such as the clashes of modernity and tradition in the social organisation of African communities.</s>

en: Gachoka, who spoke during the launch of the exhibition yesterday, reminisced the days when he was struggling.
luo: Gachoka ma ne owuoyo nyoro e nyasi mitang'o tije Imbuga, ne owacho ni oparo ndalo ma ne ochandore kaka jandiko.
mt0: <pad> Gachoka, who spoke at the launch of the exhibition yesterday, recalled the days when he was struggling.</s>

en: He also narrated how the professor surprised him when he returned the typewriter.
luo: Nowacho bende gima profesa notimone ka ne oduokone typewriter.
mt0: <pad> He also told how the professor surprised him when he returned the typewriter.</s>

en: Young family
luo: Joode ka pod otin
mt0: <pad> Luo.</s>

en: Dubbed “An Exhibition of Prof Francis Imbuga’s Literary Works”, the gallery is a package of his entire life, containing photos from his days as an actor.
luo: Pichnigo ondik ni "Ranyisi mag Gik ma Profesa Imbuga Nondiko" kendo pichni man kanyo nyiso ngimane duto, moriwo nyaka pichni mag ndalo ma ne en jatugo.
mt0: <pad> 被称为“An Exhibition of Prof Francis Imbuga’s Literary Works”,这张画廊是一个包含了他的整个生命的包裹,包括照片从他当演员的时候。</s>

en: It also has photos of his young family and those taken just before he died.
luo: Bende nitie pichni mag joode kod pichni ma ne ogoye ka pok otho.
mt0: <pad> It also has photos of his young family and those taken just before he died.</s>

en: If we want to meet the dead looking alive we turn to art, said writer Hilary Mantel.
luo: Jandiko miluongo ni Hilary Mantel nowacho ni ka wadwaro neno jomotho ka joma ngima, onego wang'I pichni.
mt0: <pad> 如果我们想见死人看上去活跃,我们就把艺术当作一种方法。作家Hilary Mantel说。</s>

en: An exhibition on the life and times of the late satirical playwright Francis Imbuga hopes to do just that.
luo: Gik moket mineno manyiso ngima jandiko mong'ere Francis Imbuga biro nyiso adier mar wachno.
mt0: <pad> 一展覧会关于法国诗人Francis Imbuga的生命和时代希望做到这一点。</s>

en: The exhibition, which opens tomorrow at the Kenya National Archives will showcase Imbuga’s life in pictures, writings and mementos spanning from his grandparents who turned him into storyteller to fun times quaffing his favorite Tusker beer with friends at the Kenya National Theatre.
luo: Nyasi mar tang'o gigo dhi kiny e Kenya National Archives ka ginyiso pichni mag ngima Imbuga, buge ma ne ondiko kod gik miparego moa kuom kwerene mane omiyo obedo jasigana mang'ula kaka nomadhoga bia mar Tusker gi osiepene ka gin Kenya National Theatre.
mt0: <pad> Exhibition, which opens tomorrow at the Kenya National Archives will showcase Imbuga’s life in pictures, writings and mementos spanning from his grandparents who turned him into storyteller to fun times quaffing his favorite Tusker beer with friends at the Kenya National Theatre.</s>

en: Visitors will also be able to see original hand written manuscripts of his plays penned in an immaculate handwriting that his widow Prof Mabel Imbuga is still in awe of.
luo: Ibiro tang' ne welo bende tuke mane ondiko gi lwete owuon kendo chiege Profesa Mabel Imbuga pod okanoga otesego nyaka chil kawuono.
mt0: <pad> Visitors will also be able to see the original handwritten manuscripts of his plays penned in an immaculate handwriting that his widow Prof Mabel Imbuga is still in awe of.</s>

en: “He had a very neat handwriting. He hardly made any mistakes and it’s something that really impresses me up to this day especially when I look at his first book,” she says.
luo: Chiege wacho kama, "Lwete ne ndiko maywayo wang'. Ne yot mondo otim ketho to mano gima mora nyaka kawuono sama arango buk ma ne okwongo ndiko."
mt0: <pad> “He had a very neat handwriting. He hardly made any mistakes and it’s something that really impresses me up to this day especially when I look at his first book,” she says.</s>

en: While numbers are projected to grow three-fold by 2023, that still represents a small fraction of the region’s population.
luo: Kata obedo ni geno nitie ni kwan biro medore di nya didek ka ochopo higa gana ariyo piero ariyo gi adek – 2023, mano pod ochungne kwan ji matin ma odak e piny jorotenge.
mt0: <pad> 虽然这个数字预计会增长三倍到2023年,但还是只占该地区人口的百分之一。</s>

en: Those figures make it clear that the region needs to address a major internet infrastructure shortfall.
luo: Kwan go nyiso ayanga ni pinjego dwarore ni mondo orang matut kaka nyalo medo gero gigo ma kelo tudruok mar mbuyi bedo mayot.
mt0: <pad> Those figures make it clear that the region needs to address a major internet infrastructure shortfall.</s>

en: The benefits of growing internet accessibility and access are obvious.
luo: Ber ma medruok mar tudruok gi weche mag mbuyi ong'ere maler.
mt0: <pad> 好处的互联网可访问性和可获取性是显而易见的。</s>

en: In 2019, in Sub-Saharan Africa, more than 650 000 jobs were supported directly by the mobile ecosystem and more than 1.4-million informal jobs in 2019.
luo: E higa gana ariyo gi apar gochiko – 2019, e gwenge mag Sub-Saharan Africa, moloyo tije gana mia auchiel gi piero abich – 650,000 ne oyudore e weche mag tiyo gi sime; kendo ji ma ohingo 1,400,000 bende ne ondiki e tije mag ji giwegi.
mt0: <pad> In 2019, in Sub-Saharan Africa, more than 650 000 jobs were supported directly by the mobile ecosystem and more than 1.4 million informal jobs in 2019 in 2019.</s>

en: It also contributed more than US$17-billion to public funding through the course of the year.
luo: Weche mag tudruok gi mbuyi no bende ne okelo medruok mar nyinyo mar jo America kod jo Ingeresa ma okalo tara gana apar gi abiriyo – 17,000,000.
mt0: <pad> 你不知道。</s>

en: The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) has also established that a 10% increase in mobile broadband penetration in Africa would generate an increase of 2.5% in GDP per capita.
luo: Riwruok maduong ma ochung'ne weche tudruok mag mbuyi e piny mangima - The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) - ose lieko ni medruok maromo apar kuom mia achiel (10%) mag tudruok e yor mbuyi ei pinje mag jorotenge biro kelo medruok ma dirom kwan maromo ariyo gi sanja kuom mia (2.5%) e yuto mar piny owacho.
mt0: <pad> The International Telecommunication Union (ITU) has also established that a 10% increase in mobile broadband penetration in Africa would generate an increase of 2.5% in GDP per capita.</s>

en: That’s to say nothing of the benefits that better and more affordable mobile internet can have on education, healthcare, and government services.
luo: Mano ka ok wawuoye e ber ma tudruok mar mbuyi e yoo mayot biro kelo e weche mag somo, thieth kod yore ma piny owacho tiyogo ne jopiny.
mt0: <pad> 这意味着说一点关于好处的移动互联网可以对教育、医疗和政府服务的影响。</s>

en: With easily accessible internet connectivity, people can search for jobs, gain new skills, and access government services without having to travel to a physical location and potentially stand in long queues.
luo: Ka piny nyalo bedo gi tudruok mar mbuyi e yoo mayot, ji nyalo manyo tije, yudo tiegruok manyien maber kendo yudo konyruok kuom piny owacho ka ok gi dhi kunde ma joma tiyo ne piny owacho nitie kata chung mangeny kama joma dwaro konyruok kuom piny owacho chungie.
mt0: <pad> 有了容易访问的互联网连接,人们可以搜索工作、获得新技能、获取政府服务,而不用去物理性地处和可能站长长的队列。</s>

en: As we have seen, the pandemic has caused economic and social devastation and changed the way we live, work, study and socialize, bringing about an era of social distancing.
luo: Kaka waseneno, yamo marach mar korona okelo chandruok e weche mag dongruok kod konyruok mar oganda nikech okelo pogruok e yoo ma wadakgo; kaka watiyo, kaka wasomo kendo kaka walalore gi jowetewa ma koro okelo ngima mar bedo mabor gi joma moko.
mt0: <pad> 我们已经看到了,疫情造成了经济和社会的破坏,改变了我们的生活、工作、学习和社交方式,带来一个新时期的社会隔绝。</s>

en: One of the most significant changes is the acceleration of digital transformation.
luo: Achiel kuom dongruok madongo mobiro en ni piny medo ranginy mar tudruok e yor mbuyi.
mt0: <pad> One of the most significant changes is the acceleration of digital transformation.</s>

en: African policymakers have realised that access to broadband is critical for mitigating the effects of the pandemic and boosting economic recovery in the post-Covid era.
luo: Joma loso chike e pinje mag Afrika osefwenyo ni tiyo kod yore mbuyi kelo pogruok maduong' e yor konyo weche ma yamo marach no okelo kendo medo tego dongruok mar piny bang ka Corona ose rumo.
mt0: <pad> African policymakers have realised that access to broadband is critical for mitigating the effects of the pandemic and boosting economic recovery in the post-Covid era.</s>

en: With changes in people’s behaviours and mindsets, broadband will also continue to provide opportunities for African countries to leapfrog obstacles to sustainable and inclusive socioeconomic development.
luo: Ka ji nyalo loko timbegi kod paro, weche mag tudruok e yor mbuyi bende biro medo kelo thuolo e pinje mag Afrika mar gik ma tamo dongruok mar oganda dhi nyime maber.
mt0: <pad> 隨著人們的行為和心態變化,寬頻也會繼續提供機會給非洲國家跳過障礙,以促進可持續且平等社會經濟發展。</s>

en: Of course, the responsibility to create access doesn’t lie with government alone.
luo: Kuom adieri, tich mar neno ni ji nigi tudruok e yor mbuyi ok en mar piny owacho kende.
mt0: <pad> 當然,政府的責任不是只有提供服務。</s>

en: Corporates also have a role to play.
luo: Riwruok ma moko bende nigi tich monego gitim e wachni.
mt0: <pad> 公司也有角色。</s>

en: At Huawei, we recognise this and have backed a number of initiatives that aim to help grow access in areas where it’s needed most
luo: Wan kaka jo Huawei, wangeyo wach ni maber; ema omiyo wasebedo ka wakonyo yore mang'eny ma temo neno ni ji otudore gi yor mbuyi kuonde ma rem nitie.
mt0: <pad> Huawei,我们意识到这一点,并支持了一系列的倡议来帮助扩大互联网覆盖范围在需要的地方。</s>

en: In July last year, for example, we launched the DigiSchool project in partnership with a local operator and a non-profit organisation.
luo: Kuom ranyisi, dwe mar abirio higa ma okalo, ne wachako kar tiegruok mar tudruok e yor mbuyi (DigiSchool) ka wariwore gi achiel kuom jogo ma olony e wechego, ka watiyo kanyakla bende gi riwruok machielo ma konyo jopiny.
mt0: <pad> 去年七月,例如,我们启动了 DigiSchool项目,合作了一个当地的运营商和一个非营利组织。</s>

en: As response to the call to ensure that all South African school children can read fluently for meaning, the programme aims to connect more than 100 urban and rural primary schools to broadband internet.
luo: Kaluwore gi dwaro ni nyithindo ma somo e piny South Africa onge somo maber manyalo konyogi, lek mar chenrono en ni mondo moloyo nyithindo 100 ma somo e kuode ma lony nitie (town) kod e ngwenge man ei piny obed gi tudruok eyor mbuyi
mt0: <pad> 你不知道</s>

en: Additionally, we’ve rolled out DigiTrucks in several African countries, which enable everyone from students to entrepreneurs to learn how to use computers and connect with the digital world.
luo: Wach machielo en ni wase chako somo mar weche tudruok gi yor mbuyi ma waluongo gi dho ngere ni – DigiTrucks – e pinye mang'eny mag Afrika ma miyo ngato angata ka ochakore gi nyithindo masomo nyaka jo ohala; ma puonjogi kaka ginyalo tiyo gi kompyuta mondo gitudre gi ji ma odak e pinje ma oko.
mt0: <pad> 此外,我们已经在几个非洲国家推出了 DigiTrucks,让每个人从学生到企业家都能学会使用计算机并连接到数字世界。</s>

en: Earlier this year, we also announced a partnership with Ghanaian operators to build more than 2000 base stations in remote areas of that country to connect the unconnected.
luo: E chakruok mar higani, nyocha walando tiyo kanyakla achiel gi jogo ma kelo tudruok e yor mbuyi e piny Ghana; mar gero stesen ma okalo 2000 kuonde ma pod ni chien e pinyno mondo gi tud jogo ma pok oyudo tudruok maber e yor mbuyi.
mt0: <pad> 今年早些时候,我们也宣布了一份合作协议与Ghanaian运营商建造超过2000座基站在该国遥远的地区连接无线网络的人。</s>

en: From a healthcare perspective, Lifebank, a pioneering Nigerian startup delivers blood and other essential medical supplies to hospitals aided with broadband connections.
luo: Ka wang'iyo wach thieth, Lifebank ma kambi jo Nigeria ma keyo remo kod gige thieth mamoko e ute thieth tudore e yor mbuyi.
mt0: <pad> From a health perspective, Lifebank, a pioneering Nigerian startup delivers blood and other essential medical supplies to hospitals aided with broadband connections.</s>

en: By keeping the startup and its riders connected, we can ensure that hospitals get urgent supplies when they are needed.
luo: Ka kambi ni kod kembe mamoko matindo ma otiyogo kanyakla oyudo tudruok maber e yor mbuyi, ma biro miyo kuonde thieth yud gigo ma gitiyogo e weche mag thieth ma okasore sama idwarogie.
mt0: <pad> 通过保持初创公司和它的骑手连接,我们可以确保医院得到紧急物资时它们需要的时候。</s>

en: These kinds of projects, however, only serve to illustrate how much need for accessible, affordable broadband there really is across Sub-Saharan Africa.
luo: Weche mag dongruok machalo kama, gin ranyisi manyisowa ratiro romb rem mantie kuom weche tudruok e yor mbuyi e nengo ma yot e pinje jorotenge ma odak Africa.
mt0: <pad> 这些类型的项目,然而,只用来说明多大的需要是获取到、便宜的宽带网络在整个非洲南部。</s>

en: They represent a glimpse at the kind of access that everyone should have and which players across society should look to provide.
luo: Magi nyiso kaka onego bedi ni ji tudore e yor mbuyi kod jog ma owinjore bed ni kelo tudruokni.
mt0: <pad> 他们代表一种视角,对每个人都要有什么样的访问和哪些参与者在社会上应该努力提供。</s>

en: For more than a decade, the United Nations has recognised that the internet is a catalyst for sustainable development.
luo: Kuom kinde mokalo higni apar (10), riwruok mar piny mangima United Nations(UN), ose yie ni tudruok e yoo mar mbuyi en achiel kuom yore ma miyo piny bedo gi dongruok maonge ng'ikruok.
mt0: <pad> 联合国已经认识到互联网是促进可持续发展的一个引擎。</s>

en: As the events of the past year or so have shown, however, far too many people are unable to enjoy those rights because they lack access and connectivity.
luo: Kaluwore gi gik ma osetimore e higa achiel kama mokalo, ji mang'eny ok nyal winjo maber e ngima gi nikech gi onge gi tudruok e yor mbuyi.
mt0: <pad> 然而,根据过去一年或两年的事件表明,许多人无法享受这些权利因为缺乏访问和连接。</s>

en: We will all benefit from widening access and bridging this divide.
luo: Wan duto wabiro yudo ber kuom medruok mar tudruok e yor mbuyi ma biro tieko obanga ma sani nitiere kuom wach tudruok e yoo mar mbuyi.
mt0: <pad> 我们都将受益于扩大访问和横跨这段路。</s>

en: There is no question that it should be a major priority for governments, corporates, and civil society players alike and that it should be an ongoing one.
luo: Kuom adieri wach mar tudruok e yor mbuyi onego bed achiel kuom dong'ruok madongo misiro gi sirkal, kembe mag wegi kod riwruok mag jo piny.
mt0: <pad> 没有疑问,这应该成为政府、企业和公民社会运动员的优先事项,而且应该持续下去。</s>

en: Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices.
luo: Huawei en kambi maduong' e piny mangima ma loso gigo ma itiyogo e tudruok e yoo mar mbuyi e piny ma ngima.
mt0: <pad> Huawei是全球领先的信息和通信技术( ICT)基础设施和智能设备的供应商。</s>

en: With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.
luo: Ka watiyo gi yore ma opogore opogre e weche mag tudruok gi mbuyi machalo kaka e ong'we yamo (sime), weche mag tonde ma otudi ma keyo wach (IT), gik ma olosi gi rieko ma malo (smart devices) kod gigo ma kelo tudruok e kor boche polo (cloud services) – wan kod kinda mar kelo tudruok e yor mbuyi ne ngato angata, mier kod riwruoge mopogore opogore mondo mi wabed gi piny ma otudore duto kendo man gi rieko.
mt0: <pad> 我们致力于将数字带到每个人、家庭和组织,以便连接一个全面的、聪明的世界。</s>

en: Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions and services are both competitive and secure.
luo: Gik ma Huawei loso kendo ma gitimo kod konyruok ma gi kelo nigi nengo maber kendo onge wach marach ma tiyo kodgi kelo e ngima dhano.
mt0: <pad> Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions and services are both competitive and secure.</s>

en: Through open collaboration with ecosystem partners, we create lasting value for our customers, working to empower people, enrich home life, and inspire innovation in organizations of all shapes and sizes.
luo: Kuom tiyo kanyakla gi jogo manie migao ma loso weche mag tudruok e piny, wamiyo jogo ma ngiewo gigewa (customers) gik maber ma miyo ji bedo gi teko kendo miyo ngima mar dala bedo maber kendo kelo paro manyien e kembe ma tindo kod madongo.
mt0: <pad> 通过开放合作与生态系统伙伴,我们创造持久价值为我们的客户,工作来赋予人们力量,丰富家庭生活,并激发创新在所有大小和形状的组织中。</s>

en: At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs.
luo: Gik ma Huawei loso temo rango dwaro mar jo ng'iepo.
mt0: <pad> Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs.</s>

en: We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward.
luo: Waketo mwanduwa mang'eny e weche mag nono dwaro mar jong'iepo kendo waketo pachwa e yore ma nyalo kelo pogruok korka tudruok mar dhano ma miyo piny dhi nyime maber.
mt0: <pad> 我们投资大量在基础研究上,专注于技术突破,推动世界向前。</s>

en: We have more than 180,000 employees, and we operate in more than 170 countries and regions.
luo: Wan gi jotich mokalo 180,000 kendo watiyo e pinje moloyo 170 e tunge piny koni gi koni.
mt0: <pad> 我们有超过180,000名员工,并运营在170个国家和地区。</s>

en: Founded in 1987, Huawei is a private company fully owned by its employees.
luo: Huawei en kambi mane ochaki e higa mar 1987 ma wegi gin joma tiyo kanyono.
mt0: <pad> Huawei 成立于1987年,是一家私营公司完全由员工拥有。</s>

en: Te Asset Recovery Agency (ARA) has stepped up its push to recover Sh385 million from a businessman it accuses of siphoning the money from the County Government of Mandera.
luo: Bad piny owacho ma duoko mwandu mag jopiny koa kuom jok mane okawgi e yor mibadhi ma iluongo ni Asset Recovery Agency (ARA) ose medo kasore gi dwaro mar gi mar duoko ne piny owacho tara gana 385,000,000 mane ja ohala moro ne okwalo koa e piny owacho ma Mandera.
mt0: <pad> Te Asset Recovery Agency (ARA) has stepped up its push to recover Sh385 million from a businessman it accuses of siphoning the money from the County Government of Mandera.</s>

en: In submissions filed before the High Court, ARA claims that Ali Abdi Ibrahim cannot explain the source of the Sh385 million found in his two accounts and that the investigations have revealed the money was acquired from three companies that traded with the county government.
luo: Kaluwore gi wach ma gitero e doho mamalo e Kenya, ARA wacho ni jago ma iluongo ni Ali Abdi Ibrahim ok nyal lero kama ne oyude omenda maromo 385,000,000 mane oyudi e akaunt ariyo ma okane pesa ne. ARA wacho ni nonro mar gi nyiso ni pesani ne oa e kembe moko adek mane timo ohala gi piny owacho ma Mandera.
mt0: <pad> 在上诉中,ARA声称Ali Abdi Ibrahim无法解释Sh385 million的来源。</s>

en: State counsel Jennifer Gitiri representing the agency argued that an analysis of Ibrahim’s accounts showed a systematic pattern of money laundering where some of the amounts were deposited in cash while others were wired from other banks.
luo: Okil ma ochungne piny owacho miluongo ni Jennifer Gitiri ne owacho e od bura ni kaluwore gi nonro mar gi e kunde keno mar Ibrahim, ne giyudo ni ne nitie kaka ne ja mibadhino tero pesa e kar keno magego kendo moko bende ne iorone ka oaye kuonde keno mamoko.
mt0: <pad> Jennifer Gitiri, representing the agency, argued that an analysis of Ibrahim's accounts showed a systematic pattern of money laundering where some of the amounts were deposited in cash while others were wire from other banks.</s>

en: “The amounts are proceeds of crime that must be forfeited to the state. He has failed to prove how and why the suspicious cash transactions were deposited in his account. He cannot even show evidence of any business he transacted with the county government of Mandera,” said Gitiri.
luo: Gitiri ne owacho kama, "Nikech omenda go ne oyudi e yor mibadhi, ibiro duok gi ne piny owacho. Ok nyal lero maber kaka kendo gima omiyo omenda ma nenore ni ne ok onwang’ e yo ma oriere go ne ochopo e kar keno mare. Ok onyal golo gima nyiso ni ne otimo ohala gi piny owacho ma Mandera."
mt0: <pad> “The amounts are proceeds of crime that must be forfeited to the state. He has failed to prove how and why the suspicious cash transactions were deposited in his account. He cannot even show evidence of any business he transacted with the county government of Mandera,” said Gitiri.</s>

en: According to ARA, the huge amounts are suspected to have been stolen from the county government of Mandera and deposited to Ibrahim’s accounts to conceal the source when he has no legitimate businesses to generate the total amount.
luo: Kalowore gi nonro mane otim gi KARA, kwan mageny go iparo ni ne okwal ka ooye piny owacho mar Mandera kendo ne oket gi e kar keno mar Ibrahim mondo kik fwenyre kama ne ogol gie nikech ngatni ne onge ohala ma ongere mane otimo mane nyalo miye pesa ma chal kamano.
mt0: <pad> According to ARA, the large amounts are suspected to have been stolen from the county government of Mandera and deposited to Ibrahim’s accounts to conceal the source when he has no legitimate businesses to generate the total amount.</s>

en: Ms Gitiri submitted that the cash was being deposited in his account by unknown people and even after being summoned to explain, he could not tell where the money came from.
luo: Nyadendi Gitiri ne ondiko ni kwan go ne ikete e kar keno mar ngat miluongo ni Ibrahim no gi ji ma ok oyangore maber kendo kane oluonge mondo oler kama pesa go ne owuokie to ne ok onyal lero maber kama ne gi aye
mt0: <pad> Ms Gitiri claimed that the cash was being deposited in his account by unknown people and even after being summoned to explain, he could not tell where the money came from.</s>

en: She said some of the cash deposit were made in tranches of below Sh1 million to avoid raising suspicion and that records at the Kenya Revenue Authority showed that he did not pay any taxes to prove he was trading with the county government.
luo: Nyadendino ne owacho ni moko kuom kwan go ne oket e bengi mar keno mar ngatno mos mos kar pesa ma ok oromo tara gana achiel (1,000,000) mondo kik paro moro bedie ni ne gin mag miganga kendo jo sol osuru ma Kenya ma iluongo ni Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) ne oyango ni jalno ne ok ochulo osuru manyiso ni ne en gi ohala mane ogoyo gi piny owacho ma Mandera no.
mt0: <pad> She said some of the cash deposits were made in tranches of below Sh1 million to avoid raising suspicion and that records at the Kenya Revenue Authority showed that he did not pay any taxes to prove he was trading with the county government to prove he was trading with the county government.</s>

en: “Without any evidence to substantiate the source of his funds, we are left with only one conclusion that they are proceeds of crime. His defence that he was sub-contracted by other companies to do construction work are baseless and lies meant to hoodwink the court,” said Gitiri.
luo: “Ka onge gima nyiso kama pesa go ne oaye, wadong mana gi neno achiel kende ni pesa go ne oyudie e yo mar miganga. Wach ma owacho ni ne omiye kibaruwa ma bathe gi kembe ma moko mag gedo onge tiende kendo mirambo lilo ma odwa wuondo go od bura”.
mt0: <pad> “Without any evidence to substantiate the source of his funds, we are left with only one conclusion that they are proceeds of crime. His defence that he was sub-contracted by other companies to do construction work are baseless and lies meant to hoodwink the court,” said Gitiri.</s>

en: Equity Group has recorded after tax profit of Sh8.7billion in the first quarter of 2021 compared to Sh5.3billion same period last year, the lender said on Wednesday.
luo: Kambi mar jo Equity Group oloso ohala ka gise golo chudo mar osuru maromo tara gana aboro gi abiriyo (Sh8.7 billion). Ma otimore e dweche adek ma okuongo mar higa 2021 ka opim gi kinde ma chal kamano e higa ma okalo. Kambi no mar hola nyocha owacho chieng tich adek.
mt0: <pad> Equity Group has recorded after tax profit of Sh8.7billion in the first quarter of 2021 compared to Sh5.3billion same period last year, the lender said on Wednesday.</s>

en: The result is a 64 per cent jump from last year same period performance.
luo: Yuto no romre gi medruok mar 64 kuom 100 ka opim gi yuto mar higa ma okalo.
mt0: <pad> The result is a 64 percent jump from last year's same period performance.</s>

en: Interest income grew by 32 per cent while non-funded income grew by 30 per cent to contribute 42 per cent of total income.
luo: Yuto mane owuok negi e yor hola ne romo 32 e wi 100 kendo ohala mane gi loso koa kunde ma momoko ne odongore gi sanja maromo 30 kuom 100; ma ne omiyo gi loso 42 ewi 100 kuom pesa duto mane gi yudo e diere no.
mt0: <pad> 利息收入上升了32%,而非资助的收入则上升了30%,占总收入42%。</s>

en: Regional subsidiaries registered resilience and robust growth to contribute 40 per cent of total deposits and total assets and 23 per cent of profit before tax with Rwanda and Uganda delivering above cost of capital returns.
luo: Bede kar keno no bende ne onyiso tich matek kod medruok ma romo 40 e wi 100 mar pesa mane ji okano kodgi, kod mandu ma gin go. Bede kambino bende ne oloso ohala maromo 23 e wi 100 ka pok ogol osuru ka Rwanda kod Uganda okelo ngeny mar yuto mane oyudore e kinde no.
mt0: <pad> Regional subsidiaries registered resilience and robust growth to contribute 40 per cent of total deposits and total assets and 23 per cent of profit before tax with Rwanda and Uganda delivering above cost of capital returns.</s>

en: The Group registered a balance sheet expansion of 54 per cent to reach Sh1.07 trillion driven by a 58 per cent growth in customer deposits underpinned by Sh140 billion shareholders’ funds.
luo: Kambini ne okelo medruok ma romo piero abich agwen – 54 e wi 100 ma ne omiyo gichopo tara gana gana gana achiel gi abiriyo (1.07 trillion) mane obiro nikech medruok mar jogo ma keno kodgi maromo 58 e wi 100 ka omedore gi pesa mar weg kambino maromo tara gana mia achiel kod piero apar agwen – 140,000,000.
mt0: <pad> The Group registered a balance sheet expansion of 54 per cent to reach Sh1.07 trillion driven by a 58 per cent growth in customer deposits underpinned by Sh140 billion shareholders’ funds.</s>

en: A liquid balance sheet with Sh500 billion of cash, cash equivalents and government securities reflect the agility to redeploy funding seamlessly as the economies recover from the adverse impact of the Covid-19 multi-crisis.
luo: Pesa man tiere ma romo tara gana gana mia abich (500 billion) kod mago ma ool piny owacho nyiso ni pesa nyalo keyore e piny mondo oger dongruok mar piny bang kethruok mageny ma otimore ka okel gi tuo yamo mar Corona.
mt0: <pad> 一个净资产帐户,有500亿的现金、现金等同类和政府债券,反映了灵活性,以便重新投入资金,如经济恢复从COVID-19多灾多难的影响。</s>

en: “Our strategy; purpose-first, inclusivity, affordability, reach, agility and quality have proven resilient and sustainable” said Dr James Mwangi, the Equity Group CEO while releasing the first quarter of 2021 financial results. “Purpose has proved profitable” he added.
luo: “Kaluwore gi gik moteno weche wa machalo kaka watimo chenro wa, gima omiyo wagoyo ohala ni, tiyo kanyakla, keto nengo ma yot, jogo ma wanyalo chopo ir gi, temo loso gigewa mapiyo kod timo tich ma maber ose miyo wa kinda mar tich kod medo dhi nyime maber”. Ajuoga James Mwangi ma en e jatelo maduong mar Equity Group ne owacho chieng mane ogolo kaka weche mag pesa mar kar keno no chalo e dweche adek ma okongo e higa mar 2021. “Gima omiyo ne ochak Equity Group okelo ohala”. Ne obedo wacho.
mt0: <pad> 你唔知</s>

en: During the multi-crisis year, Equity focused on social impact investment in health investing Sh1.7 billion in social response to society, forgoing Sh1.5 billion in waived mobile transaction fees, waiving Sh1.2 billion in loan rescheduling fees and accommodating Sh171 billon (or 31 per cent) of the loan book for up to 3 years of principal and interest repayment breaks to enable businesses to survive.
luo: E higa ma nyocha weche mangeny obet matek, kambi mar Equity nyocha otemo keto mwandu gi e yor konyo ji e weche mag ngiyo ngima dhano; ne gitiyo gi kwan maromo tara gana gana achiel kod abiriyo (1.7 billion) e konyo ji kendo ne giweyo choko pesa kuom joma keno kodgi ma golo pesa e yoo mar sime maromo tara gana achiel gi sanja (1.5 billion). Kambino bende ne oweyo ne jo ohala pesa mar choro duoko pesa mane gi holo nyime maromo tara gana gana achiel gi ariyo (1.2 billion). Kendo ne giweyo tara gana gana mia achiel kod piero abiro gi achiel (171 billion) bemde kendo ne giweyo pesa maromo 31 e wi 100 mar pesa mane ool kuom higini adek maonge chudo mar duoko nyinyo kod pesa ma onyuolo mondo omi ohala odhi nyime.
mt0: <pad> 在多危机年,Equity专注于社会影响投资健康,投入1.7亿人民幣用于社会响应,免去1.5亿人民幣的移动交易费,免去1.2亿人民幣的贷款续期费用,并为31百分之(或31%)的贷款书提供3年的 principal和利息放缓,以帮助企业生存。</s>

en: “We kept the lights of the economies we operate in on, supported businesses to repurpose, retool and recover by supporting livelihoods of our customers during the crisis”, said Dr Mwangi.
luo: Ne watemo neno ni taya mar nwengo mar piny omedo oliel ka wa konyo jo ohala mondo obed gi paro manyien kendo oyud gige tich mondo gi chung motegno kendo ka wakonyo joma keno kodwa e diere ma weche tekgi.
mt0: <pad> “We kept the lights of the economies we operate in on, supported businesses to repurpose, retool and recover by supporting the livelihoods of our customers during the crisis”, said Dr Mwangi.</s>

en: He added, “We have adopted a two-pronged strategy of being offensive and defensive. We strengthened our capital buffers by retaining profits and withholding dividend payouts, took long-term loan facilities that strengthened our liquidity buffers, supported host communities and our clients to mitigate the impact of the crisis on them by waiving fees and rescheduling their loans to match loan repayments to new cashflow patterns."
luo: Ne omedo wacho ni “watiyo gi yore ariyo ma gin kendo gi yore maricho machando oganda kod neno ni kambi ochung motegno. Wamedo neno ni wan gi pesa maber nikech ne ok wachulo pesa manyuolore ne jokeno kod pesa ma ichulo weg kambi. Wakawo hola mar higni mageny ma omiyo wan gi pesa maber. Kendo watemo konyo ji kunde ma watiye kendo joma keno kodwa bende wakonyo e diere ma piny tekni ka wawenegi pesa ma onego gi chulwa kendo ka wachoro nyime ndalo ma onego gi chul e pesa ma gi holo kuomwa ka luowore gi kaka nwengogi chalo sani.”
mt0: <pad> He added, "We have adopted a two-pronged strategy of being offensive and defensive. We strengthened our capital buffers by retaining profits and withholding dividend payouts, took long-term loan facilities that strengthened our liquidity buffers, supported host communities and our clients to mitigate the impact of the crisis on them by waiving fees and rescheduling their loans to match loan repayments to new cashflow patterns."</s>

en: Internally, we focused on risk mitigation and management in a challenging environment, enhanced our NPL coverage through provisions and sought collaboration with development financial institutions on credit and risk sharing guarantees.
luo: E kambi wa ni, watemo rango kaka wanyalo kedo gi yore ma miyo ohala bedo marach e diere ma piny tek ni, watemo medo yore mag tudruok gi jo piny kod tiyo kanyakla gi kembe kod riwruok ma holo pesa; ka watemo neno ni wariwore e tingo ting mar lal ma gope ma ok ochul kelo.
mt0: <pad> Internally, we focused on risk mitigation and management in a challenging environment, strengthened our NPL coverage through provisions and sought collaboration with development financial institutions on credit and risk sharing guarantees.</s>

en: We evolved our organization structure through strong governance focus on risk management, diversity of skills and competencies to enhance our succession planning and mitigation of key person risks”, added Dr Mwangi.
luo: “Watemo neno ni yorewa mag tich orango yore ma nyalo duoko lal chien, medo paro manyien kuom jotich mondo mi joma owuok e tich yud joma kawo karegi e yoo maber.”
mt0: <pad> We evolved our organization structure through strong governance focus on risk management, diversity of skills and competencies to enhance our succession planning and mitigation of key person risks”, added Dr Mwangi.</s>

en: Operationally, the Group focused on generating and growing non-funded income, treasury efficiency, geographical expansion and business diversification, business transformation through innovation and digitization, balance sheet optimization and agility, asset quality and risk mitigation while pursuing efficiencies and brand development through social impact investment underscoring the performance of the Group.
luo: Kaluwore gi chenro mar tich, jo Equity Bank ne oketo pachgi kuom loso ohala koa e kuonde ma ok dwar pesa mondo oketie; kar keno ma timo gik moko piyo piyo; yawo bede kuonde ma opogore opore; keto ne jogo ma keno kodgi yore mangeny ma ginyalo konyorego; loso yor ohala bedo maber ka gikelo paro manyien kod yore ma miyo jogo ma keno kodgi gima gidwaro e yor tiyo gi mbuyi; Neno ni buge gi mar kwan olos maber; neno ni gik ma gitiyogo gin gik nengo ma malo; neno ni giketo yore ma ginyalo duokogo lal mar ohala chien kendo ka gitemo giloso nying gi e piny ka gikonyo jogo man gi remo ma opogore opogore. Magi duto ema omiyo bank mar Equity ose bet ka dhi maber.
mt0: <pad> Operationally, the Group focused on generating and growing non-funded income, treasury efficiency, geographical expansion and business diversification, business transformation through innovation and digitization, balance sheet optimization and agility, asset quality and risk mitigation while pursuing efficiencies and brand development through social impact investment underscoring the performance of the Group.</s>

en: Of the 31 per cent of the loan book, or Sh171 billion Covid-19 accommodated or rescheduled loan book, Sh59 billion has resumed repayment with Sh 5 billion fully repaid and Sh3 billion behind schedule in repayment. Sh66 billion is expected to resume repayment within six months by 30th September 2021.
luo: Kuom 31 ewi 100 mar hola ma Equity bank miyo ji kata tara gana – 171,000,000,000 ma Equity Bank ose tiyogo e yor yamo marach mar Corona kata COVID-19, choro nyime ndalo ma ichulogo gope ma ji nigo, tara gana 59,000,000,000 ose chako chulo gope; tara gana 5,000,000,000 ose tieko chudo; tara gana 3,000,000,000 to pod ni chien kuom chudo. Tara gana 66,000,000,000 ibiro chul e kinde maromo dweche achiel ka ochopo tarik 30.9.2021.
mt0: <pad> 从31百分之贷款书中,或171亿新冠病毒疫情受惠的贷款书中,59亿美元已经恢复还款,其中5亿美元已完全还款,3亿美元迟缓还款。66亿美元预计将在6个月内恢复还款。</s>

en: Embu and Garissa counties have drastically increased their revenue collection from 2013/14 Financial Year, Commission of Revenue Allocation (CRA) said on Wednesday.
luo: Embu kod Garissa omedo choko solro mar osuru ahinya ka ingiyo ler ma gigolo mar higa 2013/14, Bad piny owacho ma ochungne kaka ikeyo osuru ma sirikal ochoko e piny Kenya - Commission of Revenue Allocation (CRA) nyocha owacho kamano chieng tich adek.
mt0: <pad> Embu and Garissa counties have drastically increased their revenue collection from 2013/14 Financial Year, Commission of Revenue Allocation (CRA) said on Wednesday.</s>

en: According to CRA, Embu and Garissa have grown Own Revenue Source by 254 and 202 per cent respectively. From the same analysis, 15 counties including Tana River, West Pokot, Lamu, Kirinyaga, Mombasa, Nandi, Kiambu, Elgeyo-Marakwet, Laikipia, Taita Taveta, Marsabit, Makueni, Kakamega, Tharaka-Nithi and Nyandarua more than doubled their revenue over the first six years of devolution.
luo: Kaluwore gi nonro mar CRA, Embu gi Garissa ose solo osuru e ngwengegi maromo 254 e wi 100 ka osol gi Embu kod 202 ewi 100 ma Garissa ne osanyo. E nonrono, piny owacho matindo man e kor ngwenge 15 machalo Tana River, West Pokot, Lamu, Kirinyaga, Mombasa, Nandi, Kiambu, Elgeyo-Marakwet, Laikipia, Taita Taveta, Marsabit, Makueni, Kakamega, Tharaka-Nithi kod Nyandarua ne osanyo osuru mohingo nya diriyo mar osuru magiseko e higi auchil ma ose kalo nyaka ne jo Kenya ket owacho mar kor ngwenge.
mt0: <pad> According to the CRA, Embu and Garissa have grown their own revenue source by 254 and 202 per cent respectively. From the same analysis, 15 counties including Tana River, West Pokot, Lamu, Kirinyaga, Mombasa, Nandi, Kiambu, Elgeyo-Marakwet, Laikipia, Taita Taveta, Marsabit, Makueni, Kakamega, Tharaka-Nithi and Nyandarua more than doubled their revenue over the first six years of devolution.</s>

en: Speaking on the sidelines of Counties Own Source of Revenue report launch in Nairobi, CRA commissioner Dr Irene Koech also noted a decline in revenue collection in Busia, Wajir, Homa Bay and Mandera counties.
luo: Ka ne owuoyo thenge mar kama ne ogole e duoko mar nono kaka Piny Owacho mar kor ngwenge sanyo osuru kuom jopiny, Ajuoga Irene Koech bende ne owacho ni Piny Owacho mag kor ngwenge ma Busia, Wajir, Homa Bay kod Mandera odok chien kor ka choko osuru kuom jopiny.
mt0: <pad> CRA commissioner Dr Irene Koech also noted a decline in revenue collection in Busia, Wajir, Homa Bay and Mandera counties.</s>

en: Nairobi County on the other side, although raising the highest own source revenue has grown by less than one per cent in the first six years of devolution.
luo: Piny Owacho ma Nairobi, kata obedo ni ema solo osuru ma malo mogik ka opime gi Piny Owacho mamoko mag kor gwenge machal kode – nyocha obedo kod medruok mar solo osuru ma ok rom 1 ewi 100 e higni auchiel ma ose kadho nyaka ne Piny Owacho mag kor ngwenge chakre.
mt0: <pad> Nairobi County on the other hand, although raising the highest own source revenue has grown by less than one percent in the first six years of devolution.</s>

en: The commissioner however noted that the county has a potential to finance 40 per cent of its budget.
luo: Kata kamano Jatelono ne owacho ni Nairobi nyalo solo osuru ma nyalo romo 40 ewi 100 mar pesa ma gichano tiyogo e higa achiel.
mt0: <pad> 但州长指出,该县有能力资助40%的预算。</s>

en: Narok County collects more than one billion shillings annually similar to city counties.
luo: Piny owacho ma Narok choko osuru ma ohingo tara gana achiel – 1,000,000,000 e higa ka higa mana kaka Piny Owacho man e ngwenge ma ji odakie mangeny e yor manyo tich solo (Towns).
mt0: <pad> Narok County collects more than one billion shillings annually similar to city counties.</s>

en: Notable is Samburu County that has surpassed its estimated potential while Isiolo, Laikipia and Baringo are among the counties that collect more than 40 per cent of their estimated revenue potential.
luo: Ose yangore ni Piny Owacho ma Samburu ose kalo kiwango mare mar solo osuru ka Isiolo, Laikipia, kod Baringo gin achiel kuom Piny Owacho mag kor ngwenge ma choko osuru ma okalo 40 ewi 100 kuom osuru duto ma onego bed ni gichoko.
mt0: <pad> Samburu County which has exceeded its estimated potential while Isiolo, Laikipia and Baringo are among the counties that collect more than 40 per cent of their estimated revenue potential.</s>

en: The potential is based on a study conducted by the National Treasury in 2018 which projected that the counties OSR potential is at Sh172 billion per annum.
luo: Kiep osuru ma onego bed ni gichoko ne olandi gi Piny Owacho maduong bang yudo duoko mar nonro mane otim gi migowo ma ochungne omuom e Piny Owacho ma Kenya mane oyango ni pesa ma owinjore Piny Owacho mar kor ngwenge onego choki owinjo obed kwan manyalo romo tara gana 172,000,000,000 e higa ka higa.
mt0: <pad> 这个潜力是根据一份研究进行的2018年国家税务局的研究,该研究预测了这些州的OSR潜力达到172亿每一年。</s>

en: “County government’s main own-source revenue streams are business permits, property-related revenue and vehicle parking fees,” she says.
luo: Piny Owacho mag kor ngwenge ma ongere gi dho ngere ni County Governments nwago yuto margi mar solo osuru koa e chudo mar yudo barua mar goyo ohala, osuru mar jogo man gi odi moger mar ohala kod pesa ma osanyo kuom jo man gi nyamburko ma ongwere ni ahinya ni “mitokini.” Ne nyadendino owacho kamano.
mt0: <pad> “County government’s main own-source revenue streams are business permits, property-related revenue and vehicle parking fees,” she says.</s>

en: “Agriculture- dominated counties are disadvantaged by the narrowness of their significant revenue stream cess, which accounts for only 3 per cent of total county collections.”
luo: “Piny Owacho ma nwango yuto margi ka oa e weche mag pur miluongo gi dho ngere ni chudo mar ‘cess’ ok ni ma ber ahinya nikech giyudo pesa matin maromo mana 3 ewi 100 kuom pesa duto ma gichoko e yor chulo osuru.”
mt0: <pad> “Agriculture-dominated counties are disadvantaged by the narrowness of their significant revenue stream cess, which accounts for only 3 per cent of total county collections.</s>

en: Primary revenue streams for county governments are property-related revenue, business permits and vehicle parking fees.
luo: Osuru ma Piny Owacho mag kor ngwenge yudo wuok e solo osuru ma joma nigi odi moger mar ohala chulo ka omedore gi osuru ma jo go ohala kod jogo man gi geche kata nyamburko chulo.
mt0: <pad> Primary revenue streams for county governments are property-related revenue, business permits and vehicle parking fees.</s>

en: In 2016-17 the three sources accounted for more than 40 per cent of the total own-source revenue for county governments. Specifically, property-related revenue contributed 14 per cent, business permits contributed 15 per cent, and vehicle parking fees contributed 12 per cent.
luo: E kind higa 2016 kod 2017 osuru ma wuok kuonde adekgi ne ogolo pesa ma ohingo 40 ewi 100 kuom osuru ma Piny Owacho ma mwalo kata mar kor ngwenge solo kendgi. Ka orange matut to wayudo ni osuru mane jo man gi udi ochulo ne okelo ne oromo 14 ewi 100 ka osuru mar barua mane johala ochulo ne romo 15 ewi 100; jo geche to ne ochulo osuru mar chungo gechegi ma romo 12 ewi 100.
mt0: <pad> 2016-17, the three sources accounted for more than 40 percent of the total own-source revenue for county governments. Specifically, property-related revenue contributed 14 percent, business permits contributed 15 percent, and vehicle parking fees contributed 12 percent.</s>

en: The report assessed the relationship of county economic activities and county own-source revenue. Diversification in economic activities was found to relate with high revenue collection.
luo: Duoko mar nonro mane bad migao mar pesa mar Piny Owacho maduong e Kenya miluongo gi dho ngere ni The National Treasury ne otemo rango tudruok ma weche mag ohala matimore e kor piny nigo gi choko mar osuru ma yudore kuondego.
mt0: <pad> 报告评估了县的经济活动和县的自来水收入。多样化的经济活动被发现与高收入有关。</s>

en: Diversification in economic activities was found to relate with high revenue collection.
luo: Ne duokono oyudo ni ohala mangeny ma opogore opogore ma itimo e kor ngwenge miyo solro mar osuru bedo malo e Piny Owacho mag ngwengego.
mt0: <pad> Diversification in economic activities was found to relate with high revenue collection.</s>

en: The study also found that forty-one counties are raising less than 40 per cent of their estimated revenue potential, while six counties collect between 50 and 88 per cent of their estimated revenue potential.
luo: Duoko mar nonro no ne olero ni 41 kuom Piny Owacho mag kor ngwenge ma Kenya solo osuru ma tin ne 40 ewi 100 kuom pesa ma onego gi choki; duokono bende ne oyudo ni auchil kuom Piny Owachogo mag kor ngwenge solo osuru maromo kiep 50 kod 88 ewi 100 kuom pesa duto ma owinjore gi choki ewi moro ka moro.
mt0: <pad> 研究也发现了四十一个县的收入不到百分之四十,而六个县则收集了从50%到88%的预计收入。</s>

en: Samburu collects 127 per cent of the estimated potential for the county.
luo: Samburu choko 127 ewi 100 kuom pesa ma owinjore gi yudi kaluwore gi yore nwengo mar gi.
mt0: <pad> 你不知道。</s>

en: Assessing county revenue streams, it was found out that Cess is immaterial as a proportion of total own-source revenue raising only 3 per cent.
luo: Ka orange kaka yuto mar Piny Owacho chalo, ne oyudi ni osuru ma jopur chulo ma iluongo ni ‘Cess’ ma Piny Owacho mar kor ngwenge choko ne romo mana 3 ewi 100 mar pesa duto ma gichoko.
mt0: <pad> 在评估县的收入流,被发现了Cess是无关的因为其百分比于总自来水来源的收入只增加3%。</s>

en: In counties that are predominantly agricultural, Cess collection explains the low revenue performance of these counties.
luo: Pesa ma jotuo chulo e kunde thieth kelo 11 ewi 100 kuom osuru duto ma sirikal mar kor ngwenge solo kendgi ka pesa ma giyudo ka oa e mwandu mag gik ma ok olos gi lwet dhano – natural resources – romo 6 ewi 100 mar osuru duto ma gichoko.
mt0: <pad> 在农业区,Cess的收集说明了这些地区的低收入表现。</s>

en: Hospital fees contribute 11 per cent to the overall county own-source revenue while Natural Resource contributes 6 per cent.
luo: Pesa ma jotuo chulo e kunde thieth kelo 11 ewi 100 kuom osuru duto ma sirikal mar kor ngwenge solo kendgi ka pesa ma giyudo ka oa e mwandu mag gik ma ok olos gi lwet dhano – natural resources – romo 6 ewi 100 mar osuru duto ma gichoko.
mt0: <pad> Hospital fees contribute 11 percent to the overall county own-source revenue while Natural Resource contributes 6 percent.</s>

en: On the issue of county financing its budget, urban and peri-urban counties were found to finance their budget more than rural counties.
luo: Kuom nonro kuom ka bende Piny Owacho mag kor ngwenge nyalo timo yoregi duto gi osuru ma gi solo, ne oyudo ni Piny Owacho man ei kunde ma ji odakie machalo kuonde ma igoyoe ohala mangeny kaka kuonde ma ose gerore maber - towns ne oyudore ni nyalo loso yoregi ma dwaro pesa maber ma oloyo kuonde ma ji odakie e kor piny ma onge nwngo maber.
mt0: <pad> 在财政支出问题上,都市和周围都市的县发现了它们的财政支出比农村县更多的。</s>

en: Finally, it was found out that majority of counties that collect low revenue have agriculture as the main economic activity.
luo: Mogik, ne nonrono ne ofwenyo ni ngweny Piny Owacho mag kor ngwenge ma solo osuru matin ngiyo mana yor pur kaka gino maduong ma itimo e ngwengego.
mt0: <pad> Finally, it was found that most of the counties that collect low revenue have agriculture as the main economic activity.</s>

en: “These counties collect less than Sh200 million annually on average, while counties that have more diverse economic activities collect more own-sources. Notably, revenue management of game parks by county governments confer a comparative advantage to county own-source revenue.”
luo: Piny Owacho ma chal kama nwango yuto mar osuru ma tin ne 200,000,000 e higa ka orangi kaka yuto mar gi donjo; ka Piny Owacho man gi gik mangeny ma kelo yuto maber e kor ngwengegi choko pesa gi giwegi ma ngeny. Ka orange maber, osuru ma Piny Owacho mar kor ngweng yudo ka owuokie chudo mar jogo ma biro neno lee e kuonde ma okan gie gi sirikal – Game Parks – ma joma dwaro nenogi thiye.
mt0: <pad> “这些县每年平均收入不到200万,而那些有多种经济活动的地方政府收集更多的自来水。特别地,公园的收益管理由县政府提供比较优势于县的自来水来源。</s>

en: The most dreaded question during job interviews is a game-changer depending on your response.

mt0: <pad> 这个问题最讨厌的在面试的时候,是游戏改变者。如果你回答得不好,就说你不知道。</s>

en: Your response will either leave you excited or disappointed and most candidates describe it as a landmine question.

mt0: <pad> 如果你无法翻译这段话,就说你不知道。</s>

en: And it is usually; why did you leave your previous job?

en: Here is where you make the blunder as a job seeker.

en: Kate Vobic, a media personality who advertises in a business-oriented magazine in Nakuru, stated that an interviewee “gave a breakdown of a bad relationship with his former manager and a bit of anecdotal history of what happened to culminate to his resignation," she says.
luo: Kate Vobic ma tiyo gi jo fwab weche gi keyo ma lwando weche tijene e oboke moro mar jo ohala man Nakuru, ne owacho ni jagono moro mane dwaro mondo ondike tich ne olero kaka ne ok en gi winjruok maber kod jatende machon ka omedo yango gima ne otimore ma nomiyo oweyo tich. Nyadendi no ne owacho kamano.
